;;我;;开始带有标题为“永久炖菜”的维基百科条目的屏幕截图。 “我一直想做这件事，我终于做到了……我要把这道菜煮至少一周，”安妮·劳维达（如图）对着镜头宣布，然后吩咐道：“过来，带一个配料，加入锅里！”

;

;结果，炖菜会冒泡两个月。作家兼社交媒体影响者 Rauwerda 女士在 TikTok 上记录了 TikTok 的发展，在此过程中获得了数百万次观看。 （Crock-Pot 对这种宣传感到兴奋，主动提出向她寄更多他们的产品。）她在布鲁克林的一个公园举办砂锅集会，年轻人带着各种蔬菜、香草和香料以及传单出现。

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;永久炖肉，也称为“永远的汤”，其意义就在名字中。烹饪从未停止，因为食材会根据需要补充。食用前确保混合物滚烫，可减少食物中毒的可能性；一旦温度达到 74°C (165°F)，大多数有害细菌就会死亡。 Rauwerda 女士表示，在她任职 60 天期间，没有人生病。

;

;社交媒体预示着人们对炖菜的兴趣重新燃起，因为它既便宜又美味。 2020 年，畅销美食作家艾莉森·罗曼 (Alison Roman) 的食谱建议使用 ;鹰嘴豆;和椰奶；它迅速走红并赢得了#thestew 的明确绰号。这道菜通常被认为是冬季温暖的淀粉类主食，但搜索“夏季炖菜”，您会找到大量食谱。

;

;中世纪;劳动者的卡路里来自面包和浓汤。

;

;一些永久炖菜赢得了声誉。据报道，一艘法国船从 15 世纪一直航行到第二次世界大战。战争也导致关东煮（鱼饼汤）停产，据报道，自 1916 年以来，东京 Otafuku 餐厅就一直供应这种关东煮。其后继者于 1945 年成立，至今仍保持强劲势头。

;

;位于 ;曼谷;，牛肉面汤已经在一个五英尺宽、两英尺的巨大平底锅里烹饪了半个世纪。半英尺深。店主 Nattapong Kaweeantawong 每天添加近 70 公斤牛肉，并持续搅拌成香草、香料和根的浓缩混合物。它也引起了人们的兴趣（以及味蕾）：旅行影响者 Winela World 的视频在 TikTok 上获得了近 50 万个赞。

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;除了新奇之外，吃一碗还有两个原因。一是品味。汤可能是稀薄的，但连续的汤会随着时间的推移而产生浓郁的味道。 Wattana Panich 汤的评论称赞它像肉汁一样，既“诱人”又“味道爆炸”。

;

;另一个是公共性。浓汤是在壁炉上方的大锅中制作的，通常在家庭的主要起居区：这象征着食物在将家人和朋友聚集在一起方面发挥着核心作用。法国诗人保罗·斯卡伦 (Paul Scarron) 在 17 世纪写道，浓汤“让我们的身体愉悦，/更让我们的灵魂愉悦”。

;

;在原子化的 21 世纪，与邻居分享一顿饭的想法比以往任何时候都更加遥远。但 Rauwerda 女士发现她的;Z 世代; 同事们对永久炖菜的社交和协作方面感到高兴。 “会有一些顽固分子每周都会来，并坚持到最后，”她说。其中两人现在处于恋爱关系中。当罐子耗尽时，Rauwerda 女士估计她已经喂饱了大约 100 人。毫无疑问，他们渴望更多。正如有人在 TikTok 上写道：“炖菜团队什么时候再次聚会？” ;■;

;;I;;T IS HARD; to say which was more significant: who was killed, or where. On April 1st a suspected Israeli air strike flattened a building at the Iranian embassy compound in Damascus. The blast killed seven people, among them several high-ranking Iranian officers. It was a serious  escalation in the long shadow war between Israel and Iran, hitting a target that should have been off-limits under international norms. The question now is how Iran will choose to respond—and whether it does so by attacking Israel itself or its main foreign backer, America.

;

;The strike killed General Mohammad Reza Zahedi, a commander of the Quds Force, the expeditionary wing of Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (;IRGC;).他曾多年担任该组织在叙利亚和黎巴嫩的行动负责人。 Arab and Israeli analysts say he was close to Hassan Nasrallah, the leader of Hizbullah, the Lebanese Shia militia and political party. His deputy and five other ;IRGC; officers were also killed in the blast. The general was the highest-ranking Iranian commander to be assassinated since America killed ;Qassem Suleimani; with a drone strike in 2020.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;Israeli officials did not publicly claim responsibility for the strike (though in private they leave little doubt about their role).但他们确实辩称，无论谁轰炸使馆大院，都有权这样做。 Daniel Hagari, the army spokesman, described the building in question as a “military building…disguised as a civilian building”.

;

;It is true that the ;IRGC; officers were not in Damascus to negotiate lower pistachio tariffs.当新成立的伊斯兰共和国的第一个重大行为是 1979 年在美国驻德黑兰大使馆劫持人质时，听到伊朗官员援引领事馆的神圣性令人感到恼火。但这种神圣性仍然是长期存在的全球规范。如果仅仅军人的存在就足以推翻它，那么以色列自己的一些大使馆也将成为合法目标。 Even Saudi Arabia, a longtime rival of Iran, was quick to denounce the strike, although it did not name Israel in its condemnation.

;

;Since October 7th, when Hamas militants crossed the border from Gaza and killed more than 1,100 people, Israel has been fighting on two fronts: against Hamas in Gaza, and against a wider array of ;Iranian-backed militias; across the region.其中最强大的是真主党，它几乎每天都对以色列北部的城镇和军事基地发动导弹袭击。 But the group has held back from all-out war: most Lebanese do not want their country dragged into one, and Iran is wary about risking its most useful proxy.

;

;Israel, in turn, has been avoiding striking too deep into Lebanon, lest it elicit a heavier response from Hizbullah.它的轰炸主要局限于黎巴嫩南部，不过最近几周它进一步袭击了贝卡谷地，贝卡谷地是该国东部的一片肥沃的土地，真主党在那里也有大量存在。然而，它对打击叙利亚并没有这样的保留。 After a decade of civil war, Bashar al-Assad's regime is too brittle to fight back, and the Iranian-backed militias in Syria lack the enormous arsenal of their Hizbullah comrades in neighbouring Lebanon.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;Syria offers a long list of targets: Iranian officers, allied militiamen and shipments of weapons bound for Hizbullah. It has turned into a free-fire zone for Israel, which has carried out dozens of strikes in Syria since October 7th, wiping out most of the ;IRGC;'s top leadership in the country.圣诞节那天，它在大马士革杀死了一名伊朗将军； in mid-January it killed five officers, including the ;IRGC;'s intelligence chief in Syria. Other strikes have targeted Hizbullah, including an attack on Aleppo's airport on March 29th that killed seven members of the group and dozens of Syrian soldiers.

;

;苏莱曼尼遇刺事件后，伊朗向驻伊拉克的两个美国基地发射了一连串弹道导弹作为回应——这是迄今为止最大规模的此类袭击，但并不是一些强硬派所要求的那种火与硫磺般的回应。这次可能会面临更大的国内压力来做出回应：伊朗已经经受住了以色列数月的袭击，而以色列袭击领事馆大楼现在实际上是在轰炸伊朗领土。最高领袖阿里·哈梅内伊表示，伊朗可能会直接做出回应，而不是通过其代理人做出回应。 “The evil regime will be punished by the hands of our brave warriors,” he said in a statement on April 2nd.

;

;That may well be empty talk.伊朗总是喜欢通过别人来战斗。大使馆袭击前一天晚上，一架从伊拉克发射的无人机袭击了以色列最南端城市埃拉特的一个海军基地。亲伊朗民兵联盟获得了功劳。 Iran may now approve more such attacks—and may also lash out at America.

;

;The two countries have tried to de-escalate tensions since January 28th, when an Iranian-backed group launched a drone at an American base in north-eastern Jordan and ;killed three soldier;s.作为回应，美国轰炸了伊朗在伊拉克​​和叙利亚的目标。由于担心事态进一步升级，伊朗要求其代理人暂停对美军的进一步袭击，他们勉强答应了。 American officials have made it known publicly that they had no advance knowledge of the Israeli attack in Damascus, a message they also passed via intermediaries to their Iranian counterparts.

;

;The Iranians sound unconvinced. “美国必须承担责任，”外交部长侯赛因·阿米拉卜杜拉希安 (Hossein Amirabdollahian) 4 月 2 日表示。最高领导人顾问阿里·沙姆哈尼也发表了类似言论，认为美国对此次袭击负有“直接责任”。大使馆被炸几小时后，美国军队击落了一架在叙利亚东部偏远的美国驻军坦夫附近飞行的攻击无人机。官员们不确定这架无人机是否瞄准了该基地。 Still, it was the first such incident since early February.

;

;Israel is playing a risky game in Syria.它认为自己有一个难得的机会来损害伊朗在该地区的代理人，而伊朗对更广泛的战争过于紧张，无法进行大规模报复。到目前为止，这场赌博被证明是正确的。 But past performance is no guarantee of future results: if Israel pushes too far, the region could find itself in a far messier conflict.;■;

;;James Bennet, our Lexington columnist, considers the former allies of Donald Trump and their refusal to endorse him;

;

;Bill Clinton had his share of scandals, ;as I wrote in Lexington; this week, but he was an effective and popular president, and he left office with an approval rating of 66%, according to Gallup.巴拉克·奥巴马 (Barack Obama) 的支持率也很高，达到 59%。 When the two former presidents appeared with President Joe Biden in New York on March 28th, they were plumping for money for his campaign, but they nevertheless presented a dignified tableau of mutual respect and affection, solidarity and continuity. 
;
;What a contrast with Donald Trump.另一位在世的前共和党总统乔治·W·布什甚至从未支持过他，更不用说在公开场合拥抱他了。当然，特朗普先生也利用了这一点。 His politics are grounded in the idea he is breaking with everything that came before. 
;
;What's weird, though, is that the discontinuity increasingly applies to his own term in office.他自己的副总统迈克·彭斯 (Mike Pence) 在 3 月中旬表示，他不会支持他的前任老板——这并不令人意外，因为彭斯先生指责特朗普先生“凌驾于宪法之上”，但这仍然令人震惊否认，这在美国政治层面上没有明显的先例。 It puts Mr Pence on a list of officials who served Mr Trump but have since broken with him that includes an attorney-general (Bill Barr), two defence secretaries (Jim Mattis and Mark Esper), two national security advisers (John Bolton and HR麦克马斯特）、两名参谋长（约翰·凯利和米克·马尔瓦尼）、一名参谋长联席会议主席（马克·米利）、一名海军部长（理查德·斯宾塞）、一名国务卿（雷克斯·蒂勒森）、一名国防部长education (Betsy DeVos), and a secretary of transportation (Elaine Chao), among others. 
;
;Maybe some of these people will have a change of heart, though that doesn't seem probable. （像参议员林赛·格雷厄姆这样否认对特朗普先生的批判的共和党人往往仍然有政治野心。因此，特朗普先生在共和党提名中最强大的对手尼基·黑利可能会改变立场，尽管她似乎到目前为止一直在抵制。）凯利先生称特朗普先生是“一个除了蔑视我们的民主制度、我们的宪法和我们的法治之外一无所有的人”。埃斯珀先生表示“他的行为都是为了他自己，而不是为了国家”。 Mr Bolton has said he thought foreign leaders saw Mr Trump as “a laughing fool”. 
;
;It seems to defy not just conventional politics but even common sense that such condemnation and contempt from formidable people who worked closely with Mr Trump does not matter much.至少到目前为止还没有。

;

;The odds of winning the jackpot are unimaginably low—just one in 292m for Powerball.然而销量仍创历史新高。 2023 年，美国人在国营彩票上花费了超过 1000 亿美元（见图 1）。 Were they a single company, America's lotteries would be the ninth-most profitable in the country.

;

;Why are lotteries so popular when the chances of winning are so low?一方面，它们无处不在。大约 45 个州和哥伦比亚特区运营着这些设施。低廉的价格意味着任何人都可以玩得起；巨额奖金增添了兴奋感。此外，收益往往会用于有价值的事业，例如公共教育或老年人项目。 Whereas casinos keep less than 10% of the money wagered on slot machines, state lotteries keep around 30% of ticket sales, on average.

;;;

;But the system is woefully regressive. An analysis of data obtained by ;The Economist; through public-records requests finds that poorer households spend significantly more, in absolute terms, on lotteries than richer ones (see chart 2).作为收入的一部分，这种不平衡更加引人注目。使用来自 24 个州的邮政编码级别的销售数据，我们估计家庭收入中位数每下降 10%，彩票支出就会增加 4%。年龄和种族也与彩票销售相关：老年和非白人美国人更有可能参与彩票。 But income is the most important factor.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;In the poorest 1% of zip codes that have lottery retailers, the average American adult spends around $600 a year, or nearly 5% of their income, on tickets.相比之下，最富有的 1% 邮政编码地区的人只需 150 美元，即 0.15%。换句话说，最贫困家庭的彩票支出占收入的比例大约是富裕家庭的 30 倍。大流行似乎使情况变得更糟。 In 2021 the poorest 1% of households—flush with stimulus cheques—spent $100 more on lotteries than they did in 2019. The richest 1% spent just $10 more.

;

;As for the Powerball jackpot on April 1st, hopeful ticket-buyers can look forward to another shot.尽管有六位彩票持有者通过匹配前五个中奖号码赢得了 100 万美元，但没有人赢得头奖。下一次强力球抽奖将于 4 月 3 日举行。 The jackpot stands at $1.09bn.;■;

;;T;;OTAL SOLAR; eclipses have awed people since time out of mind. The first record of one, preserved on a clay tablet found at Ugarit, now in Syria, is believed from its age and location to describe either an eclipse that happened in 1375;BC; or one in 1223;BC;.对日食的传说解释包括太阳被狗、青蛙或龙吃掉。现实更为平淡。 Eclipses are caused by the Moon moving between Sun and Earth in a way that casts a shadow on part of Earth's surface. Why are total ones, like the ;one coming on April 8th;, so rare?

;

;Solar eclipses are a special case of phenomena called transits and occultations, in which an intervening heavenly body stops light from a star reaching an observer.如果遮蔽球体在天空中看起来比恒星小，则结果称为凌日，看起来像一个穿过恒星表面的黑点（在太阳系中，水星和金星凌日，从地球的角度来看，有时到时间）。 If the obscuring object appears larger than the star, the star disappears completely—an occultation.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;Solar eclipses may be either of these things, since the apparent sizes in the sky of Sun and Moon, viewed from Earth, are almost identical. Which appears bigger depends on how far each of the three bodies involved is from the other two at the moment in question. If the result is a transit, an eclipse is known as an annular (from the Latin ;anulus;, meaning “ring”) because even at its maximum, a ring of the Sun's luminous photosphere is still visible around the月亮。 A total eclipse, though, is an occultation. The photosphere is covered completely, leaving visible only the corona, an envelope of thin plasma superheated by the Sun's magnetic field.

;

;If the Moon orbited Earth in the same plane as Earth orbits the Sun, eclipses would happen every month, but would be total only in the tropics. In reality, the average interval between total eclipses is 18 months, and they may be seen from time to time all over the world. The path of totality across Earth's surface is narrow and the period short (a maximum of just over seven and a half minutes). Outside these boundaries the Sun will appear partially eclipsed, looking like a pie that something has taken a bite from.

;

;Besides being beautiful (the effect is like a black hole punched through the sky) total eclipses are useful. Past eclipses can be dated and located accurately, which allows the correlation with modern calendars of ancient records that mention them. The blocking of the photosphere, meanwhile, enables the inner part of the corona to be studied (telescopes that mimic eclipses by blocking the photosphere also occlude this region). And one particular eclipse, in 1919, was used to test Einstein's idea that gravity affects the passage of light. Measuring the positions in the sky of stars near the eclipse's limb showed that they were, indeed, out of normal alignment.

;

;On April 8th observers in North America will witness this awesome phenomenon. At 11.07am local time, the Moon's shadow will make landfall near Mazatlán, on Mexico's Pacific coast. It will cross the American border near Radar Base in Texas. The eclipse will initially last four minutes and 27 seconds, and shrink to two minutes 53.5 seconds by the time it reaches the coast of Newfoundland, at 5.13pm.

;;
;
;

;The Great North American eclipse, as it has been called, will be a sight to behold. But it should also be cherished, because total eclipses of the Sun will not happen for ever. Tidal friction causes the Moon to recede from Earth at 3.8cm a year, making it appear smaller and smaller in the sky. In 600m years or so the last, fleeting totality will occur. If any humans are still around after that, they will have to make do with annular. ;■;
